title: Jayson Tatum says he still doesn’t have a return date after participating in a 5-on-5 scrimmage at Celtics practice
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Jayson Tatum recently participated in a five-on-five scrimmage but still lacks a confirmed return date.
Tatum has been sitting out the entire season due to an Achilles tear, focusing on a gradual rehabilitation.
Speculation grows about Tatum's return, with upcoming home games after the Celtics' West Coast trip.

title: NBC Sports broadcast teams rise to the occasion with Olympic calls from Milan Cortina
author: Chad Finn
bullets: NBC Sports broadcasters were praised for their commentary during the Milan Cortina Winter Olympics.
Kenny Albert and A.J. Mleczko delivered a memorable call during Team USA's gold medal victory in women's hockey.
Terry Gannon, Tara Lipinski, and Johnny Weir provided restrained commentary during Alysa Liu's gold-medal figure skating routine.

title: Free MBTA bus program extended â€” for now
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Boston extends free rides for three MBTA bus routes through June, using remaining federal pandemic relief funds.
Routes 23, 28, and 29, serving Mattapan, Dorchester, and Roxbury, have been free since March 2022.
City officials are discussing the program's long-term future with the MBTA, no funding beyond June confirmed.

title: Snow totals: See how much snow your town got
author: Boston.com Staff
bullets: Franklin County recorded the highest snow total with 6.5 inches in Leyden by 7 a.m. on February 21.
Essex County reported substantial snow, with Haverhill near the top at 5 inches by 9:45 a.m. on February 21.
The National Weather Service warns of a 'high impact' snowstorm with blizzard conditions expected Sunday night into Monday.

title: She’s running the 2026 Boston Marathon for the 2013 bombing victims
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: Marissa LaRosa from Canton is running the 2026 Boston Marathon to honor the 2013 bombing victims.
Inspired by a friend who ran the marathon 24 times, LaRosa overcame doubts to prepare for the race.
LaRosa views the marathon as a significant personal milestone in mental and physical resilience.

title: NH man sentenced for using $1M in COVID relief funds to buy golf course
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Michael Kirouac, 38, of Pembroke, NH, sentenced to 15 months for fraudulently using $1M COVID relief funds.
Kirouac used $600,000 in Economic Injury Disaster Loans to purchase Angus Lea Golf Course in Hillsborough.
Kirouac owned four companies and failed to disclose a sale when securing the EIDL loans.

title: Man with 25-year record charged in high-end Boston shoplifting spree
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Peter Cutelis, 40, charged with multiple thefts at high-end Back Bay stores, faces larceny and drug possession charges.
Cutelis has a 25-year criminal record; bail set at $2,500 and ordered to avoid involved locations.
Incidents include thefts at Lululemon and Ralph Lauren totaling over $9,500 in November 2025.

title: Red Sox will keep Roman Anthony in leadoff spot for 2026 season. What could rest of lineup look like?
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Roman Anthony will be the Boston Red Sox leadoff hitter for the 2026 season, manager Alex Cora confirmed.
Anthony excelled in the leadoff spot in 2025, hitting .336 with six home runs and a 1.003 OPS.
Cora plans for Willson Contreras to bat cleanup, with Trevor Story potentially hitting second for lefty-righty balance.

title: Margo Price talks AI, bro-country and meeting Joan Baez at the circus
author: Lauren Daley
bullets: Margo Price discusses her admiration for Joan Baez ahead of her Boston show at The Royale on February 21.
Price's latest album "Hard Headed Woman" received two Grammy nominations, emphasizing themes of defiance and originality.
Price and her husband Jeremy Ivey share connections to Massachusetts, including Ivey's time spent in Athol and Boston.

title: She’s running Boston so children like her daughter get access to healthcare
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: Jordan Whitaker, 25, is running the 2026 Boston Marathon to support Mass. Eye and Ear.
Whitaker's 8-year-old daughter received critical care at Mass. Eye and Ear for severe sinus cysts.
Whitaker aims to help children access specialized healthcare by raising awareness through her marathon run.
